alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 5:16AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT EASTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHERN STEVENS AND SOUTHWESTERN SPOKANE COUNTIES... At 513 AM PST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from Chewelah to Cheney. Movement was west at 10 mph. Locations impacted include... Cheney, Airway Heights, Medical Lake, Nine Mile Falls, Chewelah, Suncrest, Fairchild AFB, Reardan, Sprague, Springdale, Amber, Addy, Gravelles, Cedonia, Tyler, Mondovi, Eleanor, Deep Creek, Waukon and Little Falls Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 244 and 277. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 253 and 283. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington near mile marker 76. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 198 and 205, and between mile markers 209 and 215. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin
